lecture 1.title: The Basics
lecture 1.desc: This lecture covers the basics needed to understand the content covered in Web Systems Development.\nEverything from setting up AMP stacks to HTTP Status codes are covered.

lecture 2.title: Git and Apache
lecture 2.desc: This lecture goes over the basics of Github and Apache servers.

lecture 3.title: HTML 5
lecture 3.desc: This lecture covers the history and basics of Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) and Extensible Markup Language (XML).

lecture 4.title: CSS
lecture 4.desc: This lecture covers the basics of Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)

lecture 5.title: Advanced CSS
lecture 5.desc: This lecture covers more advanced CSS features such as animations, combinators, and frameworks.

lecture 6.title: Javascript
lecture 6.desc: This lecture coves the basics of Javascript.

lecture 7.title: AJAX and JSON
lecture 7.desc: This lecture covers the basics of both AJAX and JSON.

lecture 8.title: jQuery
lecture 8.desc: This lecture covers the basics of jQuery.

lecture 9.title: Front End Optimization
lecture 9.desc: This lecture covers front end optimizations that can improve the performance of a website or web resource.

lecture 10.title: PHP
lecture 10.desc: This lecture covers the basics of PHP.

lecture 11.title: PHP, the sequel
lecture 11.desc: This lecture covers further delves into more PHP features and concepts like interfaces, abstract classes, and polymorphism.

lecture 12.title: MySQL
lecture 12.desc: This lecture covers the basics of MySQL.

lecture 13.title: PHP & MySQL
lecture 13.desc: This lecture covers using PHP with MySQL queries, databases, and APIs.

lecture 14.title: PHP & MySQL (part 2)
lecture 14.desc: This lecture is a continuation of lecture 13 (PHP & MySQL).

lecture 15.title: Authorization & Looking Ahead
lecture 15.desc: This lecture covers authentication and authorization as well as a brief overview of the content covered \nin Web Science Systems Development.

lab 1.title: Lab 1
lab 1.desc: This lab will have you create a portfolio website for your group, which will include a portfolio site/page for each individual member of the group within.

lab 2.title: Lab 2
lab 2.desc: With your group, create a Constitution Day web application. Choose a target audience and tailor your web application\nto them. Remember to make your site accessible.

lab 3.title: Lab 3
lab 3.desc: Make a new website for ITWS. The website should contain general information about the major and core faculty as well as\ncontact information, social media links, and related news.

lab 4.title: Lab 4
lab 4.desc: Create a new website for Gamma Nu Eta. Only HTML5, CSS3, and JS may be used. A homepage and an events/activities page must be present.\nBranding material provided must be used.\nContent that appears on more than one page was must be turned into a JSON object.

lab 5.title: Lab 5
lab 5.desc: Optimize the 'Free Bee' web application. At least 7 optimizations must be implemented. Game logic must not\nbe changed. Improvements to layout and design are allowe.

lab 6.title: Lab 6
lab 6.desc: Create a simple calculator using PHP. The program must include interfaces, abstract classes, and polymorphism.\nHTML, CSS, and JS are optional.

lab 7.title: Lab 7
lab 7.desc: Use PHP to create a simple gradebook. Use MySQL to create databases that can be altered by the web application.\nList all commands used for Parts 1 and 2 of your web application in your Github ReadMe.

lab 8.title: Lab 8
lab 8.desc: Create a web application that uses utilizes JSON to dynamically display content. The web app must include a login page and a database for access
